pullRequest.title: JENKINS-61202 Make job configuration pages read-only when accessing them with the Extended Read permission
pullRequest.bodyText:
See JENKINS-61202.

Refer to discussion here:
#4149 (comment)

Freestyle with configure



Freestyle with extended-read



Pipeline with configure



Pipeline with extended-read


Pipeline looks a bit funny, but that will need fixes in workflow-global-cps-plugin
Ref: #4149 (comment)
Proposed changelog entries

Entry 1: JENKINS-61202 RFE: Users with extended read permission now get a more read-only looking UI.
...


Proposed upgrade guidelines
N/A
Submitter checklist

 JIRA issue is well described
 Changelog entries and upgrade guidelines are appropriate for the audience affected by the change (users or developer, depending on the change). Examples

Fill-in the Proposed changelog entries section only if there are breaking changes or other changes which may require extra steps from users during the upgrade


 Appropriate autotests or explanation to why this change has no tests
 For dependency updates: links to external changelogs and, if possible, full diffs


Desired reviewers
@daniel-beck

Maintainer checklist
Before the changes are marked as ready-for-merge:

 There are at least 2 approvals for the pull request and no outstanding requests for change
 Conversations in the pull request are over OR it is explicit that a reviewer does not block the change
 Changelog entries in the PR title and/or Proposed changelog entries are correct
 Proper changelog labels are set so that the changelog can be generated automatically
 If the change needs additional upgrade steps from users, upgrade-guide-needed label is set and there is a Proposed upgrade guidelines section in the PR title. (example)
 If it would make sense to backport the change to LTS, a JIRA issue should exist and be labeled as lts-candidate

nodes.bodyText: added a nil check so it doesn't fail if the button isn't present

commit.message:
Namespace css, add selector for when read-only

Remove select changes

nodes.bodyText: Can you add a comment to this block to explain its intent?
Would it make sense to extract this <j:choose> to its own jelly template?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -76,12 +76,25 @@ THE SOFTWARE. - + + + + + + N/A

nodes.bodyText:
Any chance you could format this putting attributes in multiple lines, like on other inputs on this PR?
I'm also in favour of adding spacing within ternary operators. But maybe that's too much for this PR.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -58,7 +58,7 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
 	  <td colspan="3">
       <label>
 	      <input type="radio" name="${name}" value="${value}"
-             class="radio-block-control block-control" checked="${checked?'true':null}" />
+             class="radio-block-control block-control" checked="${checked?'true':null}" disabled="${displayOnlyMode?'true':null}" />

nodes.bodyText: Could Element.hasClassName(c,"negative")) || Element.hasClassName(c, "display-only-checked" be extracted into a variable? I think this conditional complicates the xor function a bit.

commit.message: Revert change that is no longer in use

nodes.bodyText: Most of the changes in this file are whitespace only.

This seems a weird choice of name given that both Extended Read and System Read use the term Read. I'm also more familiar with "read only" as a term.
Why was this term chosen?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,15 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
 
   <l:layout norefresh="true" type="one-column" permission="${it.EXTENDED_READ}" title="${%Config(it.displayName)}">
 
+    <j:choose>
+      <j:when test="${app.hasPermission(it.CONFIGURE)}">
+        <j:set var="displayOnlyMode" value="false" />
+      </j:when>
+      <j:otherwise>
+        <j:set var="displayOnlyMode" value="true" />

nodes.bodyText: Really unnecessary whitespace change, cannot even be hidden through ?w=1 on GitHub.
